text: hello today i'm going to show you how to
train a model using amazon recognition
custom labels
this tutorial assumes that you've
already created a data set
if you haven't already created a data
set please check out our other videos to
show you how
from the amazon recognition page select
use custom labels
from here select the hamburger icon on
the left of the page
and choose projects from here
you can select create project and then
you'll want to give your project a name
in this case
we're going to use our data set that
includes pictures of different rooms in
the house
so we'll name it home classified project
and then choose create project
once you've created the project you want
to click the button for train new model
your project name will automatically be
entered and then we'll need to choose
the training data set that we created
earlier
in this case home classify
finally we need to choose our test set
this test set is a set of images that
will be used to evaluate the performance
of our model once it's been trained
in this case we're going to choose split
training data set
this will intelligently choose twenty
percent of your training set
and place it to the side your model will
then be trained on the remaining eighty
percent of the data
and once your model is trained it will
evaluate the performance of your model
on the holdout set from here we can then
click
train
now you see our model has moved to the
training and progress stage
training will typically take between one
and six hours but can take more or less
time
depending upon factors like amount of
training data
size of images and number or types of
labels
i'm going to wait a bit for this model
to train and then i'll show you the
results
now that our model has finished training
you can see it here
in the training completed stage you can
also see the model performance score of
in later videos we'll explore these
performance numbers as well as show you
how to deploy your model and perform
inference but for now that shows you how
to train
a model using amazon recognition custom
labels
thank you
